info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 07 at 7:19PM CDT until May 13 at 10:00PM CDT by NWS Saint Louis
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1030 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of south central Illinois, including the following counties, Bond, Fayette and Montgomery. * WHEN...Until 1030 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 719 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause small stream flooding. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Gilham Creek, Dry Fork, Bear Creek, Kingsbury Branch, Ramsey Creek, Raccoon Creek, Kaskaskia River, Mud Creek, Piatt Creek, Hurricane Creek, Hoffman Creek and East Fork Shoal Creek. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Vandalia, Mulberry Grove, Van Burensburg, Shafter and Hagerstown.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
